# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    current_length = 0
    for word in words
        if current_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= "\n" * word
            current_length = length(word) + 1
        else
            if current_length > 0
                result *= " "
            end
            result *= word
            current_length += length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    return result
end

example_text = "This is an example text that will be wrapped at the specified text width."
println("Example Text:\n", wrap_string(example_text))
```

Example Text:

example text that
